page.title: 04Marshlands Special School.
page.content: Marshlands School opened in 1976. There are 52 children there, ranging from 2 to 19 years, each having a special disability, usually Down's Syndrome or Cerebral Palsy which prevents them from attending a normal primary school. The children come from within a radius of nine miles, so transport can be a problem. Taxis are used every day but money is being raised to provide a minibus with a tail lift. There are lots of staff at Marshlands as the children need plenty of attention. Behaviour modification is used to encourage the children to do well, and computers are also used to aid learning. The average leaving age is 17. They then go to an Adult Day Care or Training Centre.
